means: 将才，（指挥、管理和领导的）才干，将军军阶、地位、任期或权力

sentence.Network_en: We have muddled through, not by great generalship, but by the courage of common men.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们勉强地取得了胜利, 不是指挥的才干, 而是靠士兵的勇气.

sentence.Network_en: The generalship of the Union was far inferior.
sentence.Network_cn: 联邦政府军的指挥官才能差得很远.

sentence.Network_en: It needed a prodigious amount of generalship to marshal these forces.
sentence.Network_cn: 要统帅这些队伍,需要惊人的将才.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 英语新词汇与常用词汇的翻译... ... generally 一般 generalship 将才 generant 发生的.
一般而言，将道（GENERALSHIP）或为将之道，包涵两方面内容，其一是作为战争的实际遂行者的作为，其二是作为国家最高军事 …
下面有有些说法，可供您过目： ◆ 策略源自古希腊字（Strategies）意即反映将军用兵之术（GENERALSHIP） 。 ◆ 韦氏词典中定 …

list.abs: ...一世，以后数年中，为保卫法国而与西班牙人和萨伏依人作战。1609年升为法国元帅，并且继承为多菲内中将(lieutenant-generalship)，1597年获莱迪吉耶尔继承权给他的女婿夏尔一世·德·布兰切弗 (克雷基侯爵)|夏尔·德·克雷基.
I'm always at your command 只愿追随大王左右，听候差遣I appreciate your generalship 不失为大器and your understanding 不拘泥小节

means.word_mean: 1. the leadership ability of a military general

auth_sentence.content: His generalship and steadying influence were a great comfort to his team.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: His generalship and steadying influence were a great comfort to his team.

auth_sentence.content: An obvious high-flyer, Phan was seen as a possible premier should Tung succeed to the secretary generalship.
